page.title: 07PERSONALITIES - GAMEKEEPER
page.content: Mr. Long works for{Birch Estate}and lives is a cottage in an isolated part of Birch Park. In the{breeding season he rears about 5,000 pheasant chicks. About 200 stock birds are kept which lay the eggs to be incubated. Four breeds of pheasants and two breeds of partridges are reared on the estate. When the chicks are hatched they are kept in warm pens and fed until they are fully grown. Adult birds escape into cover of the{woodland.}The {shooting season}begins in October and goes through to February. Shoots are held fortnightly in Birch in season. Mr Long begins work at 5.30am most mornings when he sets off on his rounds of the estate to feed the birds. He controls pests such as rabbits, pigeons, grey squirrels and moles.
